English (United States)(en-US): The Moon’s gravitational pull\nis stronger than one would think.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달의 중력은 상상보다 크다.

English (United States)(en-US): When it affects Earth, it causes\nthe sea to rise toward it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달의 중력이 지구에 미쳐, 바닷물을\n세게 끌어당기며 생기는 현상을….

English (United States)(en-US): This phenomenon is called the spring tide.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘조석’이라고 하는데.

English (United States)(en-US): What are you up to, <뭉치>?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치, 뭐 하는 중이었어?

English (United States)(en-US): Oh.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어.

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>, you’re here.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, 왔구나.

English (United States)(en-US): I was reading. Watched a documentary,\nand read a few more books before that.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 독서하던 중이었어. 오늘 달에 관한\n책 열 권과 다큐멘터리 하나를 봤어.

English (United States)(en-US): You know, <nickname>.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 있잖아, <nickname>

English (United States)(en-US): To move someone, to become the\ndriving force behind a push or a pull.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 누군가를 움직인다는 거, 어떠한\n울림과 흐름의 동력이 된다는 건 말이야-

English (United States)(en-US): How breathtaking it must be.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그건 얼마나 벅차오르는 일일까.

English (United States)(en-US): Do you know the feeling? Have you\never moved someone deep within?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너도 그 벅참을 알아?\n타인의 마음을 움직여 본 적 있어?

English (United States)(en-US): Yes, I have.|No, not yet.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 있어.|아니, 아직은.

English (United States)(en-US): How?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어떻게?

English (United States)(en-US): I once guided someone.|I once comforted someone.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 누군가를 이끌어 줬었어.|누군가를 따스하게 안아 줬었어.

English (United States)(en-US): I lit someone’s path, and\nled them forward like a lantern.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 누군가의 길을 등불처럼 밝히며\n이끌어 주던 때가 있었어.

English (United States)(en-US): I encouraged them, and\ncomforted them like a hearth.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 누군가를 모닥불처럼 따스하게 데우고,\n행복하게 하던 때가 있었어.

English (United States)(en-US): But someday….
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 언젠가는….

English (United States)(en-US): I want to guide someone.|I want to comfort someone.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 현명함으로 누군가를 밝혀 주고 싶어.|따스함으로 누군가를 데워 주고 싶어.

English (United States)(en-US): I hope my wisdom will be the\nlantern that lights their path.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나의 현명함이 누군가의 길을\n밝히는 등불이 될 수 있기를 바라.

English (United States)(en-US): I hope my warmth will comfort\nsomeone, and encourage them.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나의 따스함이 누군가를 데우고,\n행복할 수 있게 하기를 바라.

English (United States)(en-US): But what is all this about, <뭉치>?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그런데 뭉치, 이건 갑자기 왜?

English (United States)(en-US): Oh, oh, well.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아, 아, 음.

English (United States)(en-US): See, the Moon is moved by the Earth.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 있지, 달의 동력은 지구야.

English (United States)(en-US): The gravity of the Earth,\nits blue-green beauty.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 지구의 중력, 지구의 푸르름.

English (United States)(en-US): The uncontrollable fondness you feel\ntowards those you can’t help but love.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어쩔 수 없이 사랑할 수밖에 없게 되는\n속성들을 향한 속절없는 애정.

English (United States)(en-US): You make the Moon sound like a true romantic.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달의 공전을 이렇게 이야기하니까…\n꽤나 낭만적인 순애보 같네.

English (United States)(en-US): Humans call it ‘one-sided love.’
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인간들은 그걸 짝사랑이라고 불러.

English (United States)(en-US): One, sided?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 짝, 사랑?

English (United States)(en-US): Yes. When you pine for someone\nwho won’t return your feelings.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 혼자 애타 하며 따라다니는 거.

English (United States)(en-US): I see. One-sided, one-sided.\nIt has a funny ring to it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇구나. 짝사랑, 짝, 사, 랑.\n발음이 재미있는 단어야!

English (United States)(en-US): And, and, <nickname>, today I learned\nfrom my books and the documentary,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그런데, 그런데, <nickname>, 오늘 읽었던 책\n두 권과 다큐멘터리에서 알게 되었던 건데.

English (United States)(en-US): that the Moon can also move things.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달도 무언가의 동력이 될 수 있대.

English (United States)(en-US): Like what?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어떤 것의 동력?

English (United States)(en-US): Like the sea! The sea is\nmoved by the Moon.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 바다의 동력! 바다의 동력이 달이래.

English (United States)(en-US): The gravity of the Moon,\nits… blue-gray mist.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달의 중력, 달의… 어슴푸레함.

English (United States)(en-US): When the Moon’s gravity affects Earth,\nand causes the sea to rise toward it…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달의 중력이 지구에 미쳐, 바닷물을\n세게 끌어당기며 생기는 현상을….

English (United States)(en-US): It creates a spring tide.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘조석’이라고 한대.

English (United States)(en-US): And so the sea is drawn into a\ngentle flow of high and low tides,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그것에 의해 바다에는 너른\n흐름으로 밀물과 썰물이 치고

English (United States)(en-US): and the sea creeps closer, swells with\nhope, then retreats disheartenedly
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 바다는 다가갔다가, 홀로 부풀었다가,\n슬며시 멀어지기를 반복하며

English (United States)(en-US): and carries the currents with it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 말없이 파도를 이는 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Does the sea love the Moon,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달이 지구를 짝사랑하듯,

English (United States)(en-US): the way the Moon loves the Earth?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 바다는 달을 짝사랑하려나?

English (United States)(en-US): To move someone, to become the driving\n force behind their push or pull—
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 누군가를 움직인다는 거, 어떠한 울림과\n흐름의 동력이 된다는 건 말이야-

English (United States)(en-US): How breathtaking it must be.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그건 얼마나 벅차오르는 일일까?

English (United States)(en-US): The moon people.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달 사람들은 말이야,

English (United States)(en-US): Most of them spoke in a language that \nwas proper and neat, like that of humans.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 대개 인간의 언어를 닮은,\n네모나고 반듯한 언어를 사용했어.

English (United States)(en-US): But one of them was different.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그런데 한 명은 달랐어.

English (United States)(en-US): They called him “Sir Cello”.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달 사람들은 그를\n‘첼로 경’이라 불렀는데,

English (United States)(en-US): His speech was composed\nof soft, layered chords.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그의 언어는 켜켜이 쌓인 부드러운\n화음으로 이루어져 있었어.

English (United States)(en-US): Of course, on some grumpy days, he’d\nlet out a grating combination of notes.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 물론 가끔 기분이 나쁠 땐 듣기 싫은\n불협화음을 내기도 했던 것 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): Communicating via music… did\nthe moon people understand him?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 음악으로 소통한다…. 달 사람들은\n그의 말을 알아들었어?

English (United States)(en-US): I was confused too, at first.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나도 처음에는 의아했어.

English (United States)(en-US): I wondered how the others\nwere comprehending him.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 남들은 어떻게 이해하고\n있는 건지 궁금했지.

English (United States)(en-US): When to me, it all sounded like\nbeautiful melodies about nothing at all.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나에겐 언어의 기능이 없는,\n그저 아름답기만 한 선율이었거든.

English (United States)(en-US): And so I spent hours listening to Sir Cello’s\nmusic with no real understanding,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇게 아무런 이해 없이 첼로 경의\n음악 소리를 잠자코 듣기만 했던 시간들이

English (United States)(en-US): for hours and hours and hours,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 한 시간, 두 시간…\n다섯 시간… 그렇게 지났지.

English (United States)(en-US): with zero comprehension…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇게 이해가 안 되고,\n이해가 안 되다가…

English (United States)(en-US): until suddently I could hear him.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그냥 어느 순간 ‘들리게’ 됐어.

English (United States)(en-US): But how?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 대체 어떻게?

English (United States)(en-US): Ta-da!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 빠밤- 하고.

English (United States)(en-US): Just like that.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그냥 그렇게!

English (United States)(en-US): His language had no\npackaging or patterns,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그의 언어에 포장지나\n규칙 같은 건 없었지만

English (United States)(en-US): but nevertheless grasped\ndeep, broad concepts.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그럼에도 불구하고 깊고\n너른 것들을 담아 냈어.

English (United States)(en-US): Longing, affection, curiosity,\nregret… these kinds of things.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 사무치는 그리움, 애정, 호기심,\n후회… 이런 것들 말이야.

English (United States)(en-US): I was taking his language the wrong way.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그의 언어를 내가 잘못\n받아들이고 있었던 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): It had nothing to do with comprehension.\nI had to feel him simply by listening!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그건 ‘이해’의 영역이 아니었어.\n듣는 것 자체로 그를 느껴야 했던 거지! .

English (United States)(en-US): Only by looking at Sir\nCello after this epiphany
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이런 변화를 느낀 후에\n첼로 경을 바라보니

English (United States)(en-US): did I grasp who he truly was.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그제서야 그를 알 것만 같았어.

English (United States)(en-US): And who was he?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그는 어떤 사람이었는데?

English (United States)(en-US): His mellow smiles never faltered,\nbut my ears told another story.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 첼로 경은 항상 처진 눈을 하고\n푸근한 미소를 짓고 있었지만

English (United States)(en-US): His silences were marked with the\nperpetual grief of having lost someone.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그의 정적 속에는 누군가를 잃은,\n지울 수 없는 슬픔이 새겨져 있었고

English (United States)(en-US): His laughter was laced with relief, that he\nhad left behind a past riddled with pain…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그의 웃음소리에는 오물과 악취, 고통스러운\n과거로 범벅된 구렁텅이를 지나…

English (United States)(en-US): and reclaimed the monotony of a life\nwith sadness as his steady companion.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 먹먹한 삶의 관성을 되찾았다는\n안도가 서려 있었어.

English (United States)(en-US): (Ask about their communication)|(Ask about their relationship)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 소통의 성공 여부가 궁금하다|첼로 경과 뭉치의 이야기가 궁금하다

English (United States)(en-US): Sounds like there’s a story to that.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 숨겨진 이야기가 있을 것만 같네.

English (United States)(en-US): So, were you finally able\nto communicate with him?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래서, 드디어 소통할 수 있게 된 거야?

English (United States)(en-US): Oh…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아이구…

English (United States)(en-US): Sir Cello must have been happy, when\nyou appreciated him for who he was.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그를 알아준 뭉치를 보며, 첼로 경도,\n내심 행복했겠다. 그래서 어떻게 됐어?

English (United States)(en-US): Yes. I told him I understood him now,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 그래서 당신을 이해한다고 말해줬더니

English (United States)(en-US): and he thumped his round belly\nwith delight and sang me a song.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그는 신나하며 퉁퉁한 배를 두들겨\n리듬을 타며 노래를 불러 주었어.

English (United States)(en-US): The song was one of a plain far away,\nsomewhere no longer within reach.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 노래 안엔 이제는 갈 수 없는\n어느 먼 곳의 평야가 담겨 있었어.

English (United States)(en-US): And on that plain stood\nSir Cello with a human girl.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 위엔 첼로 경과 어떤 인간이 서 있었어.

English (United States)(en-US): Gazing at them from afar, I mused\nover each and every note sung by him.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그들을 멀리서 바라보며, 난 첼로 경이\n불러주는 노래의 음표 하나하나를 곱씹었지.

English (United States)(en-US): It was a tale of beauty and melancholy,\nweaving major and minor scales together,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 첼로 경은 장음계와 단음계를 넘나들며\n아름답도록 슬픈 이야기를 들려주었고...

English (United States)(en-US): And when he finished with a passionate\nfortissimo and let out a long breath mark,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그가 격정적인 포르티시모의 강세로 마지막\n한 마디를 하고 긴 쉼표를 내쉬었을 때,

English (United States)(en-US): I could caress his sorrow like my own.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나도 그의 슬픔을 나의\n것처럼 어루만질 수 있었어.

English (United States)(en-US): I wanted to comfort him.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 위로해 주고 싶었어.

English (United States)(en-US): So I approached him quietly, climbed\non his lap, and closed my eyes again.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래서 조용히 다가가 그의 무릎에\n올라가서 다시 눈을 감아 봤어.

English (United States)(en-US): Hoping that he would\ncarry on with his song.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그가 그의 노래를\n계속 들려 주길 바라며….

English (United States)(en-US): About your moon transmitter, Dot.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치, 저 달나라 송신기 있잖아.

English (United States)(en-US): I’d like to know the story behind it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 저 물건에 대한 이야기가 궁금해.

English (United States)(en-US): Edison pinned it on me, before\nI left the Moon and headed for Earth.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 저건 달에서 지구로 떠나 오기 전, 에디슨\n선생이 나의 몸에 꽂아 주었던 물건이야.

English (United States)(en-US): Pinned it on you?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 몸에 꽂아 주었다?

English (United States)(en-US): Yes. I was still adjusting to my new hands…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 나는 태어난 지 얼마 되지\n않아 악력이 약했으니….

English (United States)(en-US): I guess she trusted the stickiness\nof my body over my shaky grip!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그녀는 어쩌면 내 손보다 내 몸의\n점성을 더 신뢰했을 수도 있겠어!

English (United States)(en-US): Did Edison make it herself?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 에디슨 선생이 만든 물건이야?

English (United States)(en-US): Yes, she did. She was a very clever\nand talented scientist on the Moon.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 맞아. 그녀는 명석하고\n총명한 달나라 과학자였어.

English (United States)(en-US): She studied everything there is to know about humans.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인간에 대한 모든 걸\n탐구하며 그들을 연구했지.

English (United States)(en-US): Her love and affection for them shone\nthrough her research and inventions.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그녀의 논문과 발명품들에는 인간을\n향한 깊은 애정과 호기심이 담겨 있었어.

English (United States)(en-US): A lot of moon beings love humans, huh?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달에는 인간을 사랑하는\n이들이 정말 많구나?

English (United States)(en-US): Very much. All three of the moon beings\nthat kept me company loved humans,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응응, 내 옆을 지켜 주었던 세 명의\n달 청소부들은 전부 인간을 아주 사랑하고,

English (United States)(en-US): and missed them too.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 또 아주 그리워했어.

English (United States)(en-US): Edison said she invented this\nbecause she admired humans,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 에디슨 선생은 인간에 대한 아주 큰 동경,\n그리고 그보다 거대한 그리움으로

English (United States)(en-US): and missed them even more.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이 발명품을 만들었다고 했지.

English (United States)(en-US): Missed them? Have they\never met humans before?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그리움? 그들이 인간을 전에 만난 적이 있던 거야?

English (United States)(en-US): Oh, yes. So to speak. Edison, and\neveryone that cleaned the Crater,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아, 응. 말하자면. 그녀, 그리고\n크레이터를 청소하던 모든 이들은

English (United States)(en-US): once looked after human’s dreams up\nin the factory, from what I’ve heard.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 예전에 공장 위에서 인간의 꿈을\n관리하던 직원이었다고 들었어.

English (United States)(en-US): I imagine they rooted for humans going\nabout their day with exuberance and love—
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 당시에는 아주 활기차고 호기심\n많은 사랑으로 인간의 낮을 응원하다,

English (United States)(en-US): and once night fell, sculpted dreams\nfor humans with care, and excitement.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 밤이 찾아오면 인간을 위한 꿈을 사려 깊은\n손길로, 아주 신나게 조각하기 시작했겠지.

English (United States)(en-US): And to think they can’t keep up with humans,\nor make dreams for them anymore.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그런데 더는 인간의 하루하루를 볼 수도,\n그들을 위한 꿈을 만들 수 없게 되었으니.

English (United States)(en-US): What happened?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 왜 그렇게 된 건데?

English (United States)(en-US): Well…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그건…

English (United States)(en-US): Not an easy story to tell, I see.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 말하기 어려운 사연이 있구나.

English (United States)(en-US): Tell me more about Edison?|Tell me more about the moon transmitter?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 다시 에디슨 선생에 대해 이야기해 줄래?|다시 달나라 송신기에 대해 이야기해 줄래?

English (United States)(en-US): She made this so transmissions between\nhumans and the Moon could take place.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 그녀는 인간과의 실시간 양방향\n송신에 대한 꿈을 가지고 이걸 만들었어.

English (United States)(en-US): But the technology isn’t quite finished yet…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아직은 기술이 부족한 탓에…

English (United States)(en-US): so transmissions from the Moon to Earth,\nand vice versa can only be sent one at a time.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달에서 지구로, 또 지구에서 달로\n개별적인 전송만 가능하지만.

English (United States)(en-US): From what you’ve told me,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 네가 이야기해 준 그녀를 상상해 보자면

English (United States)(en-US): I think she’ll perfect\nthe technology someday.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그녀는 분명 언젠가 꿈을 이룰 것 같은걸?

English (United States)(en-US): Missing someone moves you forward.|Loving someone moves you forward.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그리움은 커다란 원동력이거든.|애정은 커다란 원동력이거든.

English (United States)(en-US): Really?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 정말?

English (United States)(en-US): Sometimes I picture it too.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 실은 나도 가끔 그런 상상을 해.

English (United States)(en-US): Edison, working on an invention like this—\nor something even more incredible!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달에서 뚝딱뚝딱 연구하며 또 다른—\n어쩌면 더 멋진 무언가를 만들고 있을 그녀를!

English (United States)(en-US): Oh, what do we have here…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어, 이건 뭐지…

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>, what's this?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, 이게 뭐야?

English (United States)(en-US): That's the doll I used to play with as a kid.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어릴 때 가지고 놀던 인형이네.

English (United States)(en-US): 1 Don’t need it anymore. Throw it away.|2 Childhood memories. Keep it safe.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 더는 필요 없으니 버린다|그래도 소중했으니 간직한다

English (United States)(en-US): I took it wherever I went and played\nhouse with it. It was my best friend.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 옛날에 어딜 가든지 들고 다니면서\n소꿉놀이를 하곤 했어. 진짜 좋아했었는데.

English (United States)(en-US): I don't know where\nto put it now though…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그런데 지금 이걸 둘 곳이 있으려나….

English (United States)(en-US): It was nice seeing it after so long,\nbut I guess I’ll have to throw it away.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 오래간만에 다시 보니까 반갑지만\n어쩔 수 없이 버려야겠네.

English (United States)(en-US): You're throwing it away?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 버리기로 한 거야?

English (United States)(en-US): But doesn’t that doll carry traces of\na time that belonged solely to you?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그런데 저 인형에는 너만이 가진\n시간의 흔적들이 묻어 있지 않아?

English (United States)(en-US): It reminds me of the playground.|It reminds me of my childhood bed.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 놀이터의 흙 냄새가 느껴져.|이불자락의 포근함이 느껴져.

English (United States)(en-US): The earthy smell of it, and\nchildren laughing with delight.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 그때 그 놀이터의 흙 냄새와 또래들의\n함박웃음 소리가 느껴지는 것 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): The snugness of the covers,\nand someone reading softly to me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이불자락의 포근함, 누군가 가만가만\n책을 읽어 주던 소리가 느껴지는 것 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): The past itself is beyond your reach,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 과거 그 자체는 네 손을 떠났지만,

English (United States)(en-US): but it left precious traces of a time gone by.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 시간들이 묻어 있는 지문은\n아직 남아 있는 거잖아.

English (United States)(en-US): Then that doll is a link to your past, isn’t it?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇다면 과거로의 소중한\n연결고리가 아닐까?

English (United States)(en-US): At least, that's what I think.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 적어도 나는 그렇게 생각해.

English (United States)(en-US): Really? Well… I still think\nI should throw it away.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래? 음… 그래도 난\n버리는 게 나을 것 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): The past is the past. What matters is right\nnow, and how to use space efficiently.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 흔적은 흔적일 뿐이야. 중요한 건\n현재와 현재의 공간 효율성이지.

English (United States)(en-US): Well… If that’s the problem…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그게 문제라면…

English (United States)(en-US): I have room in my corner!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나의 모서리에 여분의 공간이 있어!

English (United States)(en-US): Maybe I could keep it there\nfor you. No, I know I can!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그곳에 보관할 수 있을 거야.\n아니, 꼭 보관할 수 있어!

English (United States)(en-US): Well, alright. That's what we'll do.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래. 그럼 그렇게 하자.

English (United States)(en-US): I can't just throw this away. It reminds\nme of the days when I was little.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아무리 그래도 이걸 버릴 수는 없어.\n이걸 보니까 소꿉놀이 하던 시절이 떠올라.

English (United States)(en-US): That doll carries traces of a time that\n belonged solely to you, doesn’t it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이 인형에는 너만이 가진\n시간의 흔적들이 묻어 있구나.

English (United States)(en-US): The past is beyond your reach,\nsomewhere you can never go back to,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 과거는 너의 손을 떠나 다시는\n돌아올 수 없는 곳으로 흘렀지만,

English (United States)(en-US): but things stay behind, and help you\nrelive each moment time and time again.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그때를 함께했던 사물은 네게 남아\n그 시간을 몇 번이고 다시 살 수 있게 해.

English (United States)(en-US): You're right, so what if the\nhouse gets a little messy.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 맞아, 집이 조금 어질러지면 어때.

English (United States)(en-US): Keeping a small piece of my childhood\n around isn't such a bad idea.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어린 시절의 작은 조각 하나쯤은\n집에 두어도 나쁘지 않을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Let's see, where should I put this?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 보자, 이걸 어디에 두는 게 좋을까.

English (United States)(en-US): I have room in my corner.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나의 모서리 깊은 곳에\n여분의 공간이 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): Maybe I could keep it there\nfor you. No, I know I can!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그곳에 보관할 수 있을 거야.\n아니, 꼭 보관할 수 있어!

English (United States)(en-US): I want to brush the dust off your past.\nIt will let me see you with clarity.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 네 과거에 쌓인 먼지를 살살 털어 줄 수도 있을 거야. 널 더욱 잘 알게 되겠지!

English (United States)(en-US): You know, that’s a nice thought.\nI’ll leave it to you then.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 고마운 생각이네. 그럼 이\n인형은 너에게 맡길게.

English (United States)(en-US): A trace of <nickname>.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>의 흔적.

English (United States)(en-US): So this is what a trace looks like.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 흔적은 이런 모양으로 생겼구나.
